page.title: 17Longevity in Bourtie
page.content: There are several families in Bourtie where elder relations have lived into thei nineties. Longevity canot be directly related to an outdor farming life, but it will be interesting to see whether use of chemical sprays in more recent years has any efect on lonevity in future generations. There are several families living where four generations are still extant, the eldest being over ninety, sometimes over 100. It is commonplace for funerals held in Boutie Kirkyar (churcyard) to be for persons in their eighties. The most noted lifespan is associated with the Duguid family of Boutie House. Miss Mary Duguid died in 1985, aged 97. She was born in 1888, when her farther, Peter Duguid, was 71 years old. he was born five years after the Napoleonic War in 1817.
